candidates.definition: Naturally occurring bodies of water formed by geological processes, including lakes, rivers, seas, and oceans.

positive_examples: The lake was crystal clear and surrounded by pine trees.
We sailed across the ocean to reach the distant island.
The river meandered through the valley before reaching the sea.
Fish populations in freshwater lakes have been declining.
The Mediterranean Sea is known for its warm, salty waters.
Mountain streams feed into the larger river system.
negative_examples: The swimming pool was heated and chlorinated for guests.
Water filled the construction site after heavy rains.
The irrigation canal carries water to the farm fields.
A water tank stores drinking water for the building.
The fountain in the plaza shoots water twenty feet high.
Rainwater collected in puddles on the sidewalk.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: ArtificialWaterways, WaterContainers, WaterSystems, FlowingWater

candidates.definition: Bodies of water that move in currents, streams, or rivers, including their systems and connection points.

positive_examples: The river rushed downstream toward the ocean.
Two streams converged at the confluence below the mountain.
The current carried debris along the Pacific equator.
Water flowed from tributary streams into the main river system.
The mouth of the Mississippi empties into the Gulf of Mexico.
Interconnected canals and rivers form the inland waterway network.
negative_examples: The lake remained perfectly still in the morning calm.
Ocean waves crashed against the rocky shore.
The pond reflected the blue sky above.
Ice covered the frozen reservoir completely.
Groundwater seeped slowly through the soil.
The bay provided a sheltered harbor for boats.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: StaticWaterArea, OceanArea, LakeArea, CoastalWaterArea

candidates.definition: Water areas specifically designated or used for marine vessel operations and navigation.

positive_examples: The cargo ship waited in the designated anchorage before entering port.
Surfers avoided the shipping lane used by commercial vessels.
The yacht was assigned to berth number seven at the marina.
Large waves crashed in the surf zone near the harbor entrance.
The ferry followed the established waterway through the archipelago.
Coast Guard vessels patrolled the busy shipping corridor.
negative_examples: Children played in the shallow tide pools along the rocky shore.
The submarine dove deep into the abyssal ocean depths.
Fish spawned in the quiet waters of the mountain lake.
The river delta spread into countless marshy channels.
Swimmers enjoyed the calm waters of the secluded cove.
The underwater volcano created new thermal vents on the seafloor.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: DeepWater, CoastalWater, InlandWater, TidalZone

candidates.definition: Specific regions of water bodies defined by particular characteristics or purposes for monitoring or utilization.

positive_examples: The dam's reservoir provides an excellent zone for hydroelectric power generation.
Scientists monitor sea surface temperatures in designated Pacific regions to track El Niño patterns.
This section of the river has sufficient flow strength for our hydropower project.
The tropical ocean zone shows unusual temperature variations this season.
Engineers identified prime waterway areas suitable for renewable energy development.
Climate researchers focus on specific oceanic regions where temperature anomalies occur.
negative_examples: The entire Pacific Ocean covers a vast area of the Earth's surface.
Ships navigate through international waters without restrictions.
The lake provides drinking water for the surrounding communities.
Swimmers enjoy the calm waters near the beach.
Fish migrate through various water bodies during spawning season.
The river flows continuously from mountains to the sea.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: NavigableWaters, FreshwaterSources, CoastalWaters, DeepSeaRegions
